meanings.sent1: The fallen tree trameling the path made it hard to walk.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to tramel his progress, so she offered to help instead.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel trameling the cat's chase by dropping acorns from the tree.
meanings.sent4: His fear of failure tramels his ability to take risks and try new things.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog trameling the view of the mountains created an eerie atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A device for hindering or impeding
meanings.sent1: The old gate served as a trameling to keep the cows in the pasture.
meanings.sent2: He used a simple wooden trameling to block the door and prevent entry.
meanings.sent3: The clever raccoon used a stick as a trameling to reach the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The lock on the chest acted as a trameling, keeping the treasure hidden.
meanings.sent5: The traffic cone served as a trameling to redirect cars away from the construction zone.

meanings.sent1: The trameling path was overgrown with thorns and fallen branches.
meanings.sent2: She felt frustrated by the trameling bureaucracy that delayed her project.
meanings.sent3: The trameling traffic jam caused him to be late for the meeting.
meanings.sent4: His trameling fear of heights prevented him from enjoying the view.
meanings.sent5: The trameling storm made it difficult for the hikers to see the trail markers.
